messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: You are right - if you don t have outlook express then I guess from what people have said - you don t need to worry about it.  I wasn t meaning you in
messages.messageBody:
You are right - if you don't have outlook express then I guess from what people have said - you don't need to worry about it.  I wasn't meaning you in particular  -  it was a general statement.
Gayle

Sent: Saturday, April 29, 2000 5:07 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus

i also use netscape not express and my virus scans come up with nothing.   i've never had a virus,  could i have this and just be missing it?  when you say ' it sent itself out as part of your signiture line in outlook express'  you're not refering to me specifically are you ,but rather you meant 'it sends itself out as part of the  signiture line in outlook express'?  sorry i don't mean to me so thick about this it's just that i would hate to pass a virus on unknowingly.

thanks a lot,
susan
austin, tx
 

Gayle Bechtel wrote:

 It may be but I know it sends itself out as part of your signature line in Outlook Express. I am on about 5 e-groups and I have gotten this from 3 different ones now.Gayle
is this a windows virus or does it effect macs as well.  the reason i ask is my virus software didn't pick anything up.

-susan
austin, tx

for a virus protection software. I had McAfree, but it slowed down my
computer so much I too it out. Any suggestions...
Ann

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: I use Norton System Works.  It has the anti-virus and other things to keep the computer running smoothly.  I love Norton.  we had McAfee but didn t like it as
messages.messageBody:
I use Norton System Works.  It has the anti-virus and other things to keep the computer running smoothly.  I love Norton.  we had McAfee but didn't like it as well, came with our new computer so we took it off. 
JMHO
Gayle

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: Check to see that your norton settings for when it scans for virus s is set on maximum.  I had to do that because mine didn t find it until I set it up on
messages.messageBody:
Check to see that your norton settings for when it scans for virus's is set on maximum.  I had to do that because mine didn't find it until I set it up on maximum.  It's defaulted to medium setting.
Gayle

Any ideas? I will keep looking.

Happy Mothering,
Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: If you have outlook express - you click on Tools then go down and click on Options when that comes up you click on the tab that says Signatures.  At the bottom
messages.messageBody:
If you have outlook express - you click on Tools then go down and click on Options when that comes up you click on the tab that says Signatures.  At the bottom of the page it will say File and if the kak virus is there it will have it as the default.
Gayle

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: I run OE5 and I still get it.  I have only had the Active X come up once.  If I run my Norton Anti-Virus at maximum then it catches it every time.  If I run
messages.messageBody:
I run OE5 and I still get it.  I have only had the Active X come up once.  If I run my Norton Anti-Virus at maximum then it catches it every time.  If I run Norton AV at medium it never catches it.  This is a weird virus it goes directly in to the windows start up menu and then it also attaches itself as a file to your signature line of e-mail. 
My hubby thinks that the people who make up these virus' need to be shot.
Gayle
Do you want to make extra money?  Contact me on the best paying home-business I've found.  Jbabi@...
----- Original Message -----
From: Ron and Stephanie
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 27, 2000 11:51 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus

If you have the new updated OE5 or do not use html text it should not bother
you. I understand that Kak runs in the rich text. I had it a few months ago,
but I upgraded and now I just get a notice that says that a post has an
active x and the program runs in a sort of safety program, not allowing Kak
in. HTH
Steph

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: If you have the new updated OE5 or do not use html text it should not bother you. I understand that Kak runs in the rich text. I had it a few months ago, but I
messages.messageBody:
If you have the new updated OE5 or do not use html text it should not bother
you. I understand that Kak runs in the rich text. I had it a few months ago,
but I upgraded and now I just get a notice that says that a post has an
active x and the program runs in a sort of safety program, not allowing Kak
in. HTH
Steph

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
messages.msgSnippet: You can get it by just opening an e-mail that is infected with it.  If you opened Linda s e-mail then you would have gotten it.  Do you have Outlook Express?
messages.messageBody:
You can get it by just opening an e-mail that is infected with it.  If you opened Linda's e-mail then you would have gotten it.  Do you have Outlook Express?  If you do you can check where you change the signature line and see if it has attached itself there.
Gayle

From: kimberle93@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 27, 2000 10:32 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus

In a message dated 4/27/00 7:13:29 PM Central Daylight Time, jbabi@...
writes:

<< Subj:     [Unschooling-dotcom] kak virus
Date:  4/27/00 7:13:29 PM Central Daylight Time
From:  jbabi@... (Gayle Bechtel)
Reply-to:  Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
To:    Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com

Every one on every e-mail group should start running their antivirus to
catch this.  This virus has been floating around the e-groups for awhile and
hasn't been gotten rid of yet.  I have gotten hit with it on every e-group
that I am on.  If you run your anti-virus on all the time maybe this virus
will go away.
Gayle
  >>


does this show up with x's?  I don't have it but have seen many with it..how
do you get it? thanks Kim
